characters: CATH AND DAN, ON THEIR RADIOS
FLASH MEMORY- THE CAVES- FROM THE FIRST FILM-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm clouds scud over a mountain range. Imposing peaks impassable pine forest. A phone line RINGS OVER, CONNECTS to... VOICEMAIL MESSAGES. Ghost voices.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH CARTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Sarah Carter. I’m away for the rest of the month and won’t be picking up messages.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Beth. I’m in America, so please don’t leave me a message as it’s so expensive to pick them up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two abandoned 4x4 jeeps. On one bumper, a ‘Rock chic’ sticker. Inside, a cellphone GLOWS on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, this is Holly’s phone. No shit! Leave a fuckin’ message. Unless you’re Bobby Flynn- Bobby piss off you stalker creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A backwoods cabin. Dark forest encroaching all around.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Rebecca Van Ney. I’m out of the office until the 13th. In emergencies, you can reach me via Juno Kaplan on-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eerily empty ROOMS, CORRIDORS. Party leftovers. The girls suitcases, clothes, cosmetics, photo albums, medication.. A cellphone VIBRATES...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO KAPLAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is Juno. I can’t make the phone right now. Please leave a short message and I’1l get back to you when I can. A long message BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black screen. A MAN’S VOICE-

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN RESCUE RANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is Pulaskie Mountain Rescue. We have an open flightplan which you filed for Boreham Caverns which you failed to close yesterday. We have no record of your return and your listed outside contact has not heard from you. Please call us urgently if you have forgotten to sign back in. If we don’t hear from you, we will assume you are still underground and scramble an emergency response. Flashlights finally pierce the black DAN SHEPHERD leads his RESCUE TEAM - GREG and Cath - as t edge sideways along a thin, sloping seam. Dan’s 42, a geologist by training, has an instinctive fee for the rock. An Englishman, he is precise and spare in h movements and manners. Cath’s 26, a conservationist, who doubles as a rescue volunteer. Greg’s 22, a climbing instructor and extreme sports junki always first up for a thrill-ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a JUNCTION. Dan gestures to Cath. She puts on headphones. Sweeps each passage with a directional microphone. Under the hiss, SOMETHING FAINT. It sounds like CLICKING. Cath turns up the dial. Concentrates. Half-heard against electronic hum: CLICK. CLICK. Fricative, faintly human. Greg GLUGS his sports drink. Dan silences him. They stand, statues, as Cath focuses, frowns... CLICK. CLICK. Signs of life? Or static hiss? Dan shines his torch in the direction of the microphone. tunnel tapers to a crawlspace. He gives Greg the nod. Greg disappears like a dachshund a rabbit hole. Dan follows. Then Cath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight. Claustrophobic. The team wriggle on hands and knee the tunnel tapers ever tighter. Rock bears down above. A false move dislodges stones and dust on Cath. The dust settles. Cath settles herself. The team burrow on, plunging through a FLOODED SECTION...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I ever tell you Winston Churchill’s motto? KBO.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Keep Buggering On.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Who’s Winston Churchill? They KBO. Into a STALAGMITE CHAMBER. Cath emerges last, wet, to a pat on the back from Dan. Th slightest smile. CLICK. CLICK. Their flashlights locate the source of the sound: water dripping on a discarded energy drink bottle.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Could be them.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: (bagging the bottle) Juno Kaplan’s no tourist. She was president of my college cave club.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She good?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: She was a back-stabbing, man-eating bitch. But she could cave.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: When can I meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s just your type. A glory hunter. Always looking for uncharted routes. Not a team player- Dan runs his hands along the wall, dripping with water.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rainwater’s leaching through. Few hours, this whole run’1l be flooded. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb a sheer rockface. Methodically, skillfully. Halfway up, Greg bangs in a piton, clips a carabiner to i secures a new rope, drops it over the overhang to Cath. As he climbs on, he doesn’t see the piton slip from its anchor position. As the piton takes the strain of Cath’s weight, it POPS f the wall. Cath, on the rope below, falls away... Below, stalagmite spikes await her falling body. Dan reacts fastest: engages his body belay, a mechanical friction brake that grips on her safety rope and stalls h descent... Stopping Cath, inches above impalement

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Time to turn back. He doesn’t let her see the friction burn on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Give up? Now?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rest up, refocus.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: My focus’s fine. Dan holds up Greg’s loose nut. Greg’s bravado slips in Ca glare.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg, you ever ask yourself: who rescues the rescuers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge into bright light and heavy rain. An emergenc operation has commandeered the car park: police, paramedi TV news crews. Above the cave entrance, a rainbow SIGN depicts a grotto of stalagmites and stalactites. Bright letters proclaim- “WELCOME TO BOREHAM CAVERNS!” Dan and his team pass the next rescue shift, wishing them luck. They stride on, past a news team. A FEMALE TV REPOR does a stand-up to camera.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With the community still shaken from last year’s Slapton Quarry tragedy, here in Boreham, it’s fresh heartache. As the search for the missing women moves into its second day «PRBS is fading for Senator kai niece, Juno, and her five friends- Dan strides past, through the shot.

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER
dialogues.text: Man, we’re live here! Dan strides on. Cath smiles... As Dan strides past SHERIFF RILEY, doing interviews. A pi pro, Riley’s a salesman whose product is himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF RILEY
dialogues.text: We will literally leave no stone unturned until we find those girls.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Sheriff Riley.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF RILEY
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me, thank these brave-

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thank us when we find them. Dan pounds past, uninterested. Greg likes the glory, ling

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg! (Greg catches up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got four hours. Grab some food and sleep.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: You too Dan. Something in her smile galls Greg. Dan strides off toward the concessions hut that serves as the emergency command center.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You wanna share a sleeping bag?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Greg, the other night- I was as drunk as a skunk-

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (snickering) Best skunk I’ve ever had.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Go to bed Greg. Shaking her head, she strides off, leaving him stranded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks past tat and trinkets, up to the rescue mapboar

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dan. The voice stops Dan. History here. He turns to face CHIEF DEPUTY REDMOND ‘RED’ VAINES. An old-school lawman, who sh from the hip, Vaines looks tired and careworn.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Chief.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: we’ve followed their flight plan right through, traced all the trade routes and black spots. Not a whisper. People are getting tired.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Not our Sheriff. Outside, they see Riley, bathing in news camera lights.  The TV in

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You’d never know he was up for re- election. He riding you hard?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Like Zorro. the corner distracts:

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Unanswered questions still dog the police from last year’s tragic deaths of two young sisters down Slapton Quarry... On the screen: a still photos of two smiling little girls old news footage of covered bodies stretched out from a c Dan and Vaines watch themselves on the screen. Grim. The image CLERGYMAN. cuts live: worried RELATIVES, comforted by a

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Turns out Cath in my team knew Juno Kaplan a bit back in college caving days. Bit of a wild one. Risk- taker.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Caving’s a small community, people talk. Been a lot of talk about Juno Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: And I’m sure it’s all good.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Look, I’m not one to gossip.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: No, go on.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Talk is Juno’s the sort of girl girl’s shouldn’t trust with their guys. Specially girls like Sarah Carter-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was screwing her friend’s husband?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Like I said, gossip.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Did Sarah Carter know? (Dan shakes his head) I need to talk to the husband.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He and her daughter died in a car wreck. Vaines produces a clear plastic evidence bag: inside, prescription pills for SARAH CARTER.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Seems she’s still getting over it Olanzapine. It’s an atypical antipsychotic. The clue’s in the last word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone building on a deserted mountain highway. INSIDE, an old TV plays a NEWS REPORT about Juno.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: An experienced caver, Juno Kaplan had visited Boreham Caverns many times. But for her five friends this was the first- Two DINERS watch ONSCREEN photos of Beth, Holly, Sarah-

dialogues.speaker: DINER
dialogues.text: Gangbang, which one’d you do first? SLAM! A WOMAN smacks the window next to the screen, leavi smeared bloody handprint. Diners watch dumbfounded as the woman staggers inside. She stares at them in shock. Collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines’ cell phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch, what’s up? What? Where? Vaines remembers the cameras. Moves away.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Give me an hour. Not a word on this. Closing his phone, Vaines strides to his deputy ELEN RIOS vehicle. He’s old school, white and male. She’s an ex-cit cop [29], Hispanic, a woman in a man’s world. They’re cha and cheese.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Deputy, St Luke’s, fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: St. Luke's? That's a hundred k from here?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: So don’t drive like a girl. (stopping Rios’s hand) And stay off the siren. Keep the vultures off our backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cruiser winds its way through mountain roads. I/E. ST LUKE’S HOSPITAL - NIGHT Vaines strides in. Rios struggles to match his strides.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: (reaching reception) Marie sugarpie, I’1ll reconsider those traffic tickets for a cup of joe.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE THE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: How do you like it, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hot and wet. Vaines winks. Rios winces as they walk on.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here in the country Rios, it’s called being friendly.  10.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: New York, it’s called a law suit.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Beats me why you ever left. Rios’s face frames the same question. A WARD NURSE steps into the sheriff’s path.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right, where’s the mystery girl?

dialogues.speaker: WARD NURSE
dialogues.text: She’s been sedated.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: She what?

dialogues.speaker: WARD NURSE
dialogues.text: She was hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: I got five missing girls out there and you put the one person who knows where they are to SLEEP? Vaines looks like he might hit him. The nurse shrinks bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bedside monitors BLIP Sarah’s vital signs. Stable. Then, suddenly, the BLIPS quicken. Sarah's eyes pop open. Bewildered. Struggling to compute where she is and how she got there. She eyes the unfamiliar room: her bed, her drips, her machines, her window. [It eerily echoes the first film, w she woke after the death of her family. ] She hears a sound: an all too familiar sonar CLICK. From under the bed... CLICK. CLICK. Closing in. She leans over to peer under the bed... A TALONED HAND shoots out. Sarah recoils.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CCTV monitor: Sarah, under CCTV observation, jolts, huddl The image is PAUSED. Vaines watches with DR. ROGER PAYNE. [Greybeard, gut, Vaines’s fishing buddy. ] Dr Payne fast-forwards the footage to: Sarah thrashing at invisible assailants. The doctor stops the playback

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: She’s concussed, confused. Barely knew her own name. Through an OBSERVATION WINDOW, they view Sarah asleep in next room. On a table, lies Sarah’s bloodstained belongin As they talk, Rios picks up a pendant: inscribed on it, t words, ‘love each day.’

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Physically?

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: No major wounds. Scratches, bruises... a bite mark.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: A dog?

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: A man.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Any sexual violence?

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: You’ve scraped her fingernails?

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: Miss, I’m not fresh out of med school-

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: It’s Deputy. Ignoring her, the doctor presents a zip-loc evidence bagg Vaines.  12.

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: She scratched big chunks outta someone.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: We should APB it state-wide. Some sicko might have a story written on his face.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Put it on the radio, we’ll have the press down here like flies on shit. Let’s keep a lid on this til we’ve spoken to Sarah Carter.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Someone attacked her. He might attack someone else. Vaines holds up Sarah’s bloody clothing.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: How do we know it was a he? Lotta blood for scratches and bruises. We should run matches on the other five girls. And run their dental records against that bite wound. And call Tracker Bill. I want his dogs on this right away. INT. HOSPITAL - RECOVERY ROOM - DAY. Sarah stirs, scans the room, sweaty and disorientated. A NURSE has her back to Sarah, checking Sarah’s vitals on monitors.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So you’re back with us... The Nurse places water on the bed-table, obscuring Sarah’ view. Sarah’s focus shifts to the nurse’s name tag. “JUNO” Sarah looks up as the nurse turns. It’s JUNO. Her face a vengeful death mask. Juno raises a CLIMBING PICK. And sla it down towards Sarah’s face. As Sarah SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines, Rios and the doctor watch Sarah bolt up. Awake. Vaines makes a move for the door-  13.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Chief, let me- I’ve got four years in the sexual trauma unit. I’ve seen a lot of battered women. I’m good at my job.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: This ain’t exactly domestic abuse.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: All the studies show, female vics respond better to other females.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You mean women? (beat ) Fuck up, I’1ll step straight in. INT. HOSPITAL - SARAH’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Sarah watches warily as the two police officers walk in. Vaines hangs back as Rios approaches the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah, I’m Deputy Elen Rios from Hyett County Sheriff’s Department. You’re at Hyett County Hospital. We’ve been looking for you and your missing friends. Been following your Boreham Cavern flightplan. (beat ) Did you go down Boreham Caverns? (beat ) Because your cars weren’t in the car park. And you showed up nowhere near. Overwhelmed, confused, Sarah struggles to remember

dialogues.speaker: RIOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you remember? Can you remember anything? You’re the only one who knows where your friends are. Sarah shakes her head: it’s all cotton wool, a blurred bl FLASH MEMORY [FIRST MOVIE]: Sarah stuck in the tight crawlspace, fighting to get out as the cave collapses. BACK IN THE HOSPITAL, Sarah stiffens at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Trapped.  14.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Trapped? Where? Boreham? Vaines watches on as Sarah shakes her head, as much in confusion as negation.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: You didn’t go down Boreham, did you? Why did Juno Kaplan file a fake flight plan for Boreham Caverns? Where did you go Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL, a grizzled outdoorsman, opens the bag of clothes fo his bloodhounds to sniff. Sets his hounds on the hunt. Th pick up a FOREST trail immediately. Bill and DEPUTY RYAN LYNCH follow. INT. SARAH’S ROOM, HOSPITAL - DAY Rios produces a photo: the girls posing outside their cab

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Your friends are in real trouble Sarah. (lays down more photos) Sam, Rebecca. Do you know where they are? They need your help. Can you remember anything? Sarah’s eyes lock on the photos of Sam and Rebecca. As she does the BEEP BEEP BEEP of her vitals quickens...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH MEMORY- THE CAVES- FROM THE FIRST FILM-
dialogues.text: SAM and REBECCA. Screaming. Running. Pure fear

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HOSPITAL- -
dialogues.text: The BEEP BEEP BEEP accelerates. Rios lays out more photos for Sarah. Vaines scrutinizes every flicker on her face.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Holly. Beth... FLASH MEMORY -- THE FIRST FILM... HOLLY shouts in pain. Sarah slams a rock down onto BETH’S face.  15.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Beth-

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Beth? Is she okay? What can you remember? The image torments Sarah: it’s not something she cares to share. BEEP BEEP BEEP. Her vitals race faster.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Where are they Sarah? (lays down photo of Juno) Where’s Juno? The BEEPING goes crazy. Sarah’s breathing quickens. Her pupils dilate. A SCREECH pierces through Sarah’s ears.. FLASHBACK TO -- THE FIRST FILM... Sarah and Juno lock eyes. Sarah raises a pick...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno-

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Juno- What happened to Juno? What happened to her? Sarah stares back. Vaines studies her: her eyes haunted, her face etched wit the strain- of some shocking secret? Rios, aware of Vaines itching to intervene, tries to keep patient.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Juno. Your friend? What happened to her? Sarah’s eyes waver. Her vitals BEEP faster. FLASH MEMORY: Sarah slams the pick into Juno’s leg. Juno screams. Sarah, drenched in blood, SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah convulses, tugging her drip from her hand. She clut her head. Trying to shut out the onslaught of her memorie To make sense of the fragments inside her mind. Vaines can’t contain himself any longer, charges in.

dialogues.speaker: ARE. THEY. STILL. ALIVE
dialogues.text: It’s the question Sarah can’t- or won’t- answer. They hold eye contact... Vaines’s POLICE RADIO splutters to life.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY LYNCH, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Sheriff. Come in. It’s Lynch. Vaines steps out into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Deputy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs BARK, unsettled, at the mouth of a derelict mine

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY LYNCH
dialogues.text: We’re up at Chapel Mine. Dogs tracked her scent up the hill, but kinda lost it up here. Something’s got ‘em spooked.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Chapel mine? Any sign of the other girls?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY LYNCH
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Keep looking. Rios steps out into the corridor, steaming.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I was getting through.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You were getting nowhere.  17.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: You can’t peel an orange wearing boxing gloves.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios, some day soon, come round my place, sit on the porch, sip a soda, speak to my wife. You’ll see, I can be nice. But now I got five girls missing. Dr Payne interrupts, holding a print-out

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: The blood swab from Sarah Carter’s clothes- it’s A positive- matches Juno Kaplan.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I’m A positive. A third of the state is A positive. Beat. Vaines rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: The hell do you think’s gone on here? I don’t know whether I’m looking at a victim or a suspect. (silencing Rios) And you don’t either.

dialogues.speaker: DR PAYNE
dialogues.text: She still not talking?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: She can’t remember jack shit.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Post-traumatic amnesia. Brain shuts down non-vital systems after extreme stress. Vaines looks to the doctor. He shrugs: ‘could be.’

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: For how long? (the doctor shrugs) Those girls don’t have that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Shepherd, half-awake, clutches his phone.  18.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: My team are beat.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t want to shift the whole circus, just need a couple of men to pick up where the dogs left off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Chapel Mine’s a maze. We had to pull some frat boys out a few years ago. We could search for months and still not cover it.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dan, every night in my dreams I go down Slapton Quarry, body bag those two little girls and bring out them out to their momma. Don’t tell me you don’t too. Dan looks over at Cath, asleep. He gently covers her wher her blanket has slipped. Greg, not asleep, watches.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: What if we took Sarah Carter? See if she remembers something? Narrow the search area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police cruiser races through torrential rain, past a Sh gas station that has long lost the S from its roadside si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sits numb, shutdown, on the backseat. She feels Vaines’s gaze from the front. Beside her, Rios. From the way Rios locks eyes with Vaines, it’s clear she’ thinks this is a bad decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive along a perimeter fence. Deputy Lynch greets them at a gate. CHAPEL MINE: DANGER. KEEP OUT.  19.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You recognise this? Sarah feels Vaines’s eyes still on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive past rusted machinery, toothless railway track long grass reclaiming everything... Towards the MINEHOUSE. A rackety wooden shack that houses elevator, with a spire for the pulley system.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This ring any bells? Sarah shakes her head. At the mine entrance, the RESCUE TEAM’s TRUCK awaits. Dan Cath and Greg, kitting up, salute greetings. Rios’s cellphone RINGS. Rios tries to shield her cellphon conversation from all around, especially her boss.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, hi...cookies, oh yummy... No, not tonight. Yes I promised, but remember how we talked about Mommy’s job? How I help people? Well, some people need my help tonight. Be good for Mrs Smith. Sweet dreams. Bye-bye. Bye. The police car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: When you’re ready, Deputy. Vaines gets out and opens Sarah’s door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kit up and head in. Dan points to their guns.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Heavy metal. You won’t need those. Rios hands her gun over to Deputy Lynch to look after. Da sees that Vaines is ignoring him.  20.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This is a missing person’s case. What the hell do you think you’re gonna find?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: My gun stays with me.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: (to Cath) Bet it’s got a name. They advance inside. Flashlights illuminate rusty cogs wheels, pulleys. A metal LIFT CAGE sits over an open ELEV SHAFT. Sarah, drawn back into the darkness, stiffens, instantly uneasy. Vaines tries to read recognition in her response.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah? Is this familiar? Sarah is unresponsivlM@#&hding at the shaft, looking down into the dark, she retreats further into herself.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hello? This is Hyett County Sheriff Department. ANYBODY THERE?!

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah? You recognise anything here? All eyes on Sarah: Sarah shrinks; some limbic survival se tells her something’s not right Dan shines his torch down the shaft: his beam doesn’t penetrate the depths of the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: She couldn’t have climbed up here.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: It’s a big mountain. I’m sure there’s some foxhole somewhere she coulda climbed out. But we don’t know it- and this takes us direct to the main vein, connects to the cave system. Right?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No one knows those caves. It’s hostile down there. And she looks like a ghost.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if she has a major flashback or flip-out, or finds her friends dead?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: We don’t know they’re dead. I just want confirmation we’re in the right arena. Get the nod, narrow down the area.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Red. Standard procedure- you don’t take people back down. It’s me and two rookies. I can’t take responsibility for her.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Dan, we got five girls might still be alive. She’s the only one who's been down there. There’s a million miles of caves and fuck-all time. Bend the fuckin’ rules.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cath? (Cath nods) Greg? Greg cracks a snap-light, drops it down the shaft. Finall hits bottom, casts a dim glow from the distant base.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Too far for our ropes. We could piggy-back on the elevator cables.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Why not just take the elevator? Greg and Cath examine the elevator’s cogs and gears.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Bit creaky, but basically sound.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: (to Dan) Bit like you, boss. Dan nods to Vaines: let’s do it. Dan leads his rescue team into the cage. Sarah hesitates.  22.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Something down there you want to tell me about? (Sarah says nothing) Deputy. Rios escorts Sarah into the lift. Vaines clanks closed the cage door. Sarah suddenly looks trapped. The elevator is packed with bodies. Claustrophobic. Rios struggles for space. Air. Closes her eyes, taking clandes deep breaths. Opening her eyes, she sees Vaines, watching her, alive to her vulnerability. Vaines puts his hand on the release lever. Dan and Greg t the winches... Vaines releases the lever. The lift starts THE DESCENT... Sarah watches tombstone slabs of rock passing by inches f her face. Her dread rising as they descend. Above, the drum wheel turns, playing out lift cables. The wood shuttering CREAKS. Slowly the cage descends. To the terrible CLICK of ratchet teeth. Down, down, down. Darkness swallowing them up. The square of light above them receding... Sarah’s eyes, watching it go... Trying to ignore the GRINDING of the cables. Of an endless descent, a descent into hell. Soundtracked by the CLICK...CLICK...CLICK...of lift gears It’s like Sarah is descending into her past, her memories The deeper they go, the more dilapidated the mineshaft, t more degraded the mechanism. Nervous looks: do they keep going? CLICK...CLICK...  23. Each click a little aural trigger in Sarah’s head, reverberating and distorting... CLICK...CLICK... Little toxic timebombs, threatening to burst in her head. FLASHFRAME: The snap of a demonic jaw. Too short and blur to comprehend, long enough to shock. Her imagination in overdrive, Sarah can barely breathe. S shuts her eyes, trying to shut out the nightmare. But she can’t shut out the CLICK, CLICK of ratchet teeth. The CLICK, CLICK of sprocket teeth... That haunting inhuman CLICKING that rattles in her head shards of memory stabbing through... Her eyes spring open...Seeing... FLASHFRAME. In the rock relief, like a Goya devil, a CRAW snaps at Sarah... ...Sarah snaps from her stupor. She THRASHES, LASHES OUT...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: DON’T GO DOWN. THERE’S SOMETHING DOWN THERE. Sarah lurches for the lever.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Rios grabs for Sarah... Sarah slips her grasp, catches the lever. The lever’s sudden change of direction grinds hard on the teeth, snapping one, releasing the ratchet grip on the elevator cable. The lift jolts down. Throwing its occupants over, smashing them against the ca and each other. As the gear teeth catch and re-engage, the cage STOPS jus suddenly, throwing everyone down hard. But still Sarah struggles. Rios spins her into an arm loc  24.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios, you got her? But Sarah wants out. She thrashes for freedom. Rattles th cage. Vaines wades in to assist. Together they cuff her t its metal wall, restrain her.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah, calm down. It’s okay. It’s in your head. Whatever you’re seeing- it’s not real. It’s trauma. Tricks of the brain. You're safe. The cables CREAK ominously; the stressed metal GROANS. Vaines gets right in Sarah’s face.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You remember something?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Chief, the woman’s traumatised.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: They down here? They down here? (to Dan) Get us to the bottom. Dan hesitates. Vaines’s eyes brook no argument. Dan releases the lever. They continue their descent... With teeth missing, sprockets jag and slip on every revolution; the movement down is jerky and unsettling. Wary eyes flit between Sarah and the fractured mechanism. The lift grinds and stutters down. Finally, CLANK. The cage THUDS against the stone floor at the bottom of t shaft. The door at the bottom is bent, buckled and rusted. Greg struggles to yank it partially open. They have to squeeze and struggle through the gap. Vaines and Rios escort Sarah out. Vaines catches Dan’s lo Sarah huddles tight to a wall. Small, silent, watchful. R attends to her.  25.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: You want a drink? You remembered something. What did you remember? Trust me, I want to help you. Sarah stares into the deep black darkness. Dan takes Vaines aside.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I should never have let you bring her down here.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You heard her, Dan. They’re down here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The woman’s a fright. She doesn’t know what she’s saying.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Let me worry about her. Let’s just get to the cave. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Down here, I call the shots. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights. Dan leads the group along a tapering TUNNEL They squeeze past upturned coal carts, rusted mining gear Slow, hard progress, resolutely downward... Sarah, sandwiched between Rios and Vaines, watchful and watched. JUNCTION. Dan checks his map schematic.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cave’s this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team weave through pit props that have warped and shi from their foundations. They creak and groan. The roof is partially collapsed, riddled with cracks, rains down regu showers of dust. The threat of total collapse is ever present.  26. Rios fights to rein in her claustrophobia, fails to hide from Vaines. Rios focusses on the job: Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Recognise anything? Sarah sticks tight to the wall, watchful. Withdrawn. Dan Cath share a worried look. Cath’s torch flickers. Faulty.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cath, how long have I been teaching you? Your light is your life. Greg tuts, flicking his flashlight in Cath’s face. Dan catches him as he passes, taps his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Teamwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight passages. Hollows in the rough walls cast deep shad Form shapes like screaming faces. Sarah’s eyes search every corner for other movement. The shifting flashlights flick across the outline of a figure, hanging in shadow. Sarah freezes. Rios follows her look. She too glimpses something in the shadows .

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: There’s something there! Everybody swings their lights round. They illuminate-- An old mining lamp, hanging off a warped pit prop. Rios feels Vaines’s withering gaze.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: The dark does funny things to people.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I’m scared of stuffed animals. Seriously. She okay?  27.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: She look okay?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Dan’s the best. He’1ll see us through. Greg winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights cut through the dark. The team slosh and scra through the grimy, wet twisty tunnel. Cold and claggy. Greg runs his fingers across a vein of minerals glistenin the wall. He picks up and pockets a glinting nugget.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Goddamned gold mine.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Fool’s gold.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Should hit the cave system somewhere up here. The team turn a corner into a GALLERY littered with old lamps, helmets. Dan picks up an old Davey lamp, sparks it

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Blue flame shows the presence of methane. Dan checks his gas meter on his belt: it flashes red, sho a high methane count.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Woh. Watch for sparks. Secure all loose metal, crampons, picks, nuts. Guns. Flashlight falls on a gnarled horse skeleton on the floor Its skull stares up, incisors open as if screaming. An unnerving sight, met with silence. Sarah’s stares, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: What’s that? A pit pony? Dan scours the crime scene: claw marks run down one wall.  28.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Miners probably hit a methane pocket. Looks like the poor bastards tried to claw their way out. Sarah stares at the claw marks. Shaken by the flashback, Sarah shrinks against the wall. Vaines, eagle-eyed, nods to Rios.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah, help me help you- you know something. What do you know?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Up here. A CRACK in the rocks. Greg clears a crawlspace through th rocks...

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s the cave. Greg burrows through a crack in the rocks. Disappears.

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We’re getting warm! Greg appears. Holding a cracked snaplight

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Snaplight! Miner’s didn’t have these. Vindication for Vaines. He turns to Sarah. They all do.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Time to help us find your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the team haul themselves through the CRACK in an enormous CATHEDRAL CAVERN. They scan with their flashlights for signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg, T.I.  29. Greg pulls out his thermal imaging camera. A small, robus device, with a pistol-grip. Body heat registers on its sc as red hot spots as he pans across the various members of team as they probe the various tunnels. He probes the shadows. Nothing. Rios sits with Sarah, trying to coax some answers out of

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah- Anything you can tell us- anything you recognise- narrow the area- help us find your friends.

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: A noise. A CLICKING. Sarah shrinks. Peering into the blackness.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: What Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: CLICK. CLICK. Is it just in Sarah’s head?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Anyone hear that? Sounded like movement. Vaines studies Sarah’s nervous reaction.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Cath’s voice ECHOES up the mine. Sarah tightens, increasingly edgy. CLICK. CLICK. Flashframe: A full-form glimpse of a crawler attack.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: SHUT UP! THEY’LL HEAR YOU! A sudden, ferocious intervention: Sarah tries to smother from speaking. Both Dan and Greg compete to assist Cath.  30. The police officers take Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Who’1l hear you? Your friends? Sarah feels all the eyes on her. She can’t formulate word

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Creatures. She sees their faces: mirrors to her madness. Sarah stung Rios’s look.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Creatures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team clamber through the tight tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? Sarah surveys the dark, terrified what their shouts will attract. No one notices as Sarah grabs a weapon of her ow sharp flint fragment. She slips it into her trousers. The team reach a JUNCTION: THREE TUNNELS confront them. Dan’s light catches a glint in the MIDDLE TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: What’s that? Dan and Cath go into the tunnel. Cath picks up... A woman’s caving boot. Almost brand new. Everyone immediately understands its importance.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Rock’ard. That’s a British brand. All eyes turn to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: If the boot fits- The way Sarah stares at the boot is recognition enough fo Vaines, who shines his light up the TUNNEL.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (taps his ear) Cath. Cath takes out electronic LISTENING EQUIPMENT. Sweeps the cave.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: If you shut up, we might hear something. From Cath’s POV - with all SOUND amplified through her headphones - even landing water-droplets SOUND momentous.

dialogues.speaker: PLINK
dialogues.text: Cath arcs the microphone round further. Follows the sound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath leads the way.

dialogues.speaker: PLINK
dialogues.text: Drops shimmer in flashlight beams.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Flood water. Vaines stays on Sarah’s shoulder, prodding her on. Rios follows.

dialogues.speaker: PLINK
dialogues.text: Cath moves round to the far corner of the cavern. Cath stops at the SOUND. Everyone notices she’s picked up something. There’s silence. Silence... CLICK. Cath points: something’s down there... They edge towards the dark far corner. Sarah, on high-ale slows, but Vaines pushes her on. Dan signals to a halt. Because the flashlights faintly pi out something in the shadowy corner...  32. A person sitting on the ground leaning against a wall. Dan and Vaines exchange a look. Justified in his decision come this way, Vaines takes control. Pushes forward. Sees A woman. Head turned away. Face not visible. But the woma jaw is moving. Working up and down like she’s mumbling to herself. Everyone tenses.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: She’s still alive. The woman’s “chattering” teeth CLICK again. Sarah can barely breath.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Miss? You okay? Miss? Vaines moves closer. Reaches out. Touches the woman’s fac Her head lolls sideways. It’s REBECCA... Dead. Half of her face is missing. Ripped away. But, eeri her jaw is still chattering. Vaines edges in to look. Slo a fat rat slips out from inside her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Jesus! The group reels backwards. Sarah’s legs buckle; she struggles to breathe. Rios goes to the body. Examines it.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: The main arteries are severed. All eyes on Sarah. Vaines looks accusatory.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Who did this? Do you know who did this?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Chief, it’s her friend-

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: If she’s innocent, she’1l wanna help us help her friends.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: If? You don’t think-?  33. Sarah catches Rios’s non-committal look.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Woh, wait a minute. I thought she was a victim here? What are you saying, you think she’s a suspect? (silence) This is fucking crazy. Fucking crazy bringing her down here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg! Save it.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Dan, I see you keep your team well disciplined. Beat. Dan stares down Vaines. Betrayed. Rios’s flashlight settles on a scrap of Rebecca’s clothin just inside a TIGHT TUNNEL that disappears into the rock.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: She came this way.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Let’s go. Beat. Dan and Vaines lock looks.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg, take point. Greg hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I’1l go. Greg stops her. Shoves past. Burrows in...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TIGHT TUNNEL--
dialogues.text: Greg powers through. Manic. Over-compensating.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg, go easy. You get stuck in there we’1l have to break your collar bone to get you out This does little for Rios’s nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg fights on, teeth gritted.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (ON CAVE RADIO)
dialogues.text: Greg, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: GREG, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Never better.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So who’s next?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios- Vaines scrutinises her, to see if she hesitates. Rios determined not to, nods, squeezes into the tunnel... Vaines turns to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You don’t leave my sight. Sarah doesn’t move. Vaines shoves her in, bulldozing hims in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios’1l be right in front of you. I’1l be right behind.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TIGHT TUNNEL-
dialogues.text: The deeper Rios crawls, the narrower the tunnel. Squeeze tight. A claustrophobe’s constrictive hell. She couldn’t turn back if she wanted to. And, compounding her fears, S scrambling behind, contributing to the bottle-neck

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DRIPPING CAVE--
dialogues.text: Dan and Cath, alone. She gives him a little smile, disappears down the hole. Alone with Rebecca’s body, Dan’s smile slips.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TIGHT TUNNEL--
dialogues.text: Greg sees the end of the tunnel. It opens into a NEW CHAM As Greg disappears around a bend ahead, Rios loses sight him. Alone with her fears, she is floundering. Her fears winning. Starting to panic, she snags herself, fights fre dislodging rock dust. She clenches at the prospect of the imminent crush. The roof doesn’t fall in, but the weight rock hangs over her, like a vast tombstone slab.  35.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Breathe. Breathe. Meanwhile, Sarah crawls fast and catches up with Rios. Behind Sarah, Vaines struggles to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Slow down. Sarah ignores him. Cursing, Vaines redoubles his effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg pulls himself out the TUNNEL, takes off his helmet composes himself. Shines his flashlight round. The stone wall is pocked like honeycomb: black hollows le off in every direction. Rios collapses out the tunnel. She gulps air hyperventilating. Greg attends to her.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Breathe with me. In...and out...and in...and out...and in...and out...There you go, lovely big breasts. Seeing he’s trying to lighten the tone, Rios finds a smil But looking back at where she came from chills her.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I can’t do that again.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You did great.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUNNEL- -
dialogues.text: Vaines, out of shape, makes slow progress, struggles on. IN THE HONEYCOMB JUNCTION. Sarah crawls out, twitchy and watchful. Her eyes search e shadow.

dialogues.speaker: HELLO
dialogues.text: CRAWLER CLICKS still Sarah. The others pick up on her fea  36.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: What is it? Greg swings his light across the large cave.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. But he’s not sure. He scans his thermal imaging around: nothing... Only the three hotspots of their bodies...

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Calm down, it’s just in your head.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: You gotta try and be like me: big empty space between your ears. But something registers in Sarah’s eyes... SUDDENLY, A RED FILLS HIS T.I. SCREEN, A FOURTH HOT SPOT.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TIGHT TUNNEL--
dialogues.text: Vaines hears SCREAMS ahead, but his view is blocked by th twisting tunnel. He can only hear the echoing sounds of a attack, with its attendant GRUNTS, GROANS, STRIKES, SCUFFLING.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: No reply. Vaines bulls his way through the twisting tunne Rounding a bend, his view still obscured by rock, he glim shadows on the wall, human shapes fighting...

dialogues.speaker: RIOS, YOU OKAY
dialogues.text: Fighting forwards, Vaines’s gunbelt snags on the sidewall FURTHER BACK, Cath hears the ATTACK.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DRIPPING CAVE--
dialogues.text: Dan hearing GURGLING, SLASHING on the radio... Then listens as SILENCE and STATIC HISS replace SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUNNEL- -
dialogues.text: Clearing the rock, Vaines sees Sarah slip from view, esca into the honeycombs tunnels.  37.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HONEYCOMB JUNCTION--
dialogues.text: Vaines climbs out the tunnel. Surveys the scene: Sarah and Greg have disappeared. Rios lies cold on the fl Vaines goes to her aid.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios. He slaps her round. She is groggy, disorientated.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios, what the hell happened here? Where did she go?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: It was so fast. Vaines remembers his thermal imaging camera. Rewinds the image, plays back the frenzied attack: just shapes- but t impression is undeniable- one human form jumping at anoth

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Rios. Vaines looks at her with contempt SCREAMS [Greg] echo from down the tunnels. Vaines spots bloody drag-marks leading into one of the honeycomb tunnels. Drawing his gun, he follows the blood. Ten feet down, Vaines catches a glimpse of movement, give chase deeper into the honeycombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The honeycomb caverns are a maze. Multiple choices at eve turn. Vaines tracks the blood trail. Hearing SCUTTLING feet, he speeds up...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HONEYCOMB JUNCTION--
dialogues.text: Cath crawls out the tunnel, finds only a confused Rios.  38.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: What happened? Where’ve they gone? You hurt? Dan crawls out, catches Cath’s look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, tucked in the shadows, watches flashlights disappe down other passages. She tucks tight, kills her light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines hears the horrors echoing through the caves. Vaines tracks with his flashlight and Greg’s thermal imag camera down A SERIES OF TWISTING PASSAGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, Cath and Rios search the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Greg! Greg! Vaines! Fucking Honeycombs. Five minutes, they’11 all be lost. The tunnel opens out into a STALACTITE CHAMBER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: See that, stress point between two strata. Roof’s unstable. Stick to the walls. Rios looks up in fear at the limestone swords that hang a them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines hunts his prey. Suddenly, SCUFFLING SOUNDS in shadows draw his beams. Frustrated with his flashlight’s limited range, he switch to TI. Holding his gun in his other hand, he tracks... Through corkscrew tunnels. Alert to ambush points at every corner.  39.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Sarah? Sarah, this is Chief Vaines. I know you’re scared. Let’s just take it easy, talk this out. A humanoid hot spot skids across his thermal imaging fram Vaines hunts it out, scouring the darkness. From nowhere, a red figure suddenly FILLS his thermal ima Rushing him. Right on him. Slashing at him. BOOM. Vaines FIRES A SHOT off, deflecting the attacker ju as it SLAMS into him and knocks his flashlight aside. DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNSHOT quakes through the caves like rolling thunder Above Dan, Cath and Rios, the cave walls REVERBERATE with Vaines’s gun blasts.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He’1l bring down the fucking mountain. SEISMIC SHIFTS occur above their heads... They look up and see the roof vibrate, a horrendous RIFT appear... Then, like apples on a shaken tree, the STALACTITES start fall. To rain down on them...a rain of spears. They have to run to clear them. Dodging and weaving. Inch from impalement. Cath stumbles. A stalactite spear lands, inches from her face, striking through the climbing ropes around her shoulder. Pinned down, she fights to free herself. The others make it to the shelter of a SIDE TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Come on Cath! Cath gets free. But the rift in the roof causes a COLLAPS Slabs of rock fall in, blocking her path to the others.  40.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: She’s on her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dust clears, Vaines sees there is no way through t rubble, he curses through his coughs, turns back, looking another route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choking DUST consumes everything. Dan, covered in dust, scrabbles to his knees, coughing. Through the swirling particles, his flashlight picks out. Rios, totally disorientated. Dan hauls her to her feet. Both cough violently as the choking dust subsides. Dan offers Rios his water bottle to wash to her face and rinse her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Easy. That’s got to last.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Cath! Cath! Come in. (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: No reply. Rios and Dan hunt through the rubble. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Flashlight! A faint flashlight beam just makes it through a huge moun rubble. Dan and Rios scrabble over to the rockfall.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Cath! Cath! Come in. (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply. Dan shines his torch back. Flicking it ON and O

dialogues.speaker: CATH, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Dan, Dan, you there?

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: I’m here. I’m here. I can see your beam. Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath, ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROCKFALL, scans her torch around. She is buried in a cavity under a huge weight of rock. The rocks are precariously balanced. Highly unstabl Any attempt to work herself free dislodges rocks and risk rockfall that will crush her.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: No. I can’t move. I’1l bring it all down on me. I need something to support the rocks. (fighing panic) I’m stuck here Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cath, don’t panic. We’1ll work it this end. You take it easy. we’1l get you. ON THE OTHER SIDE, Dan tears at the intransigent rubble getting nowhere, losing his cool.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Come on. Come on. Fuck, fuck, fuck-

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Dan-

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Fucking trigger-happy Americans. I should never have-

dialogues.speaker: CATH, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Dan?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Don’t let her hear you like this.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hear me? There’s a fucking tonne of rubble between us. She couldn’t hear a fucking rock concert. You know what are our chances of getting to her are?  42. Storm spent, he controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cath, we can’t get through. Cath’s face falls.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Can’t you drill it? Or det it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You know I can’t. It’s too risky. You’11 have to work free.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I can’t Dan, it’1l crush me. I need you here.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’re gonna have to find another way round to you.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’1l get there.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I’m scared Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That’s good. Fear keeps you alert, keeps you alive. Cath, I promise you, I won’t stop until I get there.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You dry?

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You keep warm. Keep drinking.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Okay.  43.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’ve got to move off now, you’11 probably lose the signal. But stay on channel one.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay. We’re walking away.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Stay on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Channel one. I’m going nowhere. You take it easy. Dan’s reply is distorted, swallowed by static.

dialogues.speaker: KBO.
dialogues.text: No reply. They’ve gone. Out of range. Cath is alone. Facing her tomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan ploughs on, grim set, out of range, not knowing if he ever see Cath again. Rios follows, unable to find the right words of comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, emerges from the shadows, coated in dust. Barely human. A drip of water lands on her face, runs down her cheek li tear. Sarah traces the water source: a seam in the rock. She runs her hand down it as it widens, tracking its cour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines reaches a JUNCTION, faces a choice of five tunnels has absolutely no idea which to take.  44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several choices. Dan flicks his lighter, testing for air flow.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Cath, Cath can you hear me? (static hiss) Cath? Nothing. Dan stops, turns to Rios.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They’re volunteers. They don’t get paid. They risk their lives for every dumb-arse college kid and sports-shop caver. It’s not our job to judge. But bringing down a murder suspect?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: This wasn’t my call.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, it was mine. He presses on. Haunted. A man on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Rios’s boots CRUNCH on something underfoot... Flashlights beams reveal a carpet of bones.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What the hell-? Dan cracks a flare. Illuminates scores of animal carcasse Dan and Rios exchange looks of deep unease. Something SPARKLES in the light. Dan settles his light on carabiners, clipped to something Dan can’t quite see. He climbs a mound of bones. Passes his light over... BETH. Her face is mashed. Stoved in. Dan recoils. Across the cave...  45.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Dan!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy- Dan rushes over. Rios’s staring down at... HOLLY. Eviscerated. Her rib-cage is picked clean.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh Christ. He resists the urge to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don’t think Sarah Carter-?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: These wounds- they’re- savage.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don’t get animals down here. (ON RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath, can you hear me? Cath, can you hear me? (static hiss) Come on. Cath, can you hear me? In response, LAUGHTER. It’s coming from a CAMCORDER that Rios has picked up.

dialogues.speaker: ONSCREEN- -
dialogues.text: Sarah, Juno, Holly, Sam and Rebecca lark about for the camera. Drinking, LAUGHING in the CABIN. In the JEEP.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAVE--
dialogues.text: Rios presses the fast-forward button.

dialogues.speaker: ONSCREEN- -
dialogues.text: Fast-forwarded FOOTAGE: the girls in the woods. Finding a dead stag. Stopping at a hole in the ground...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Stop-  46. Real-time FOOTAGE: abseiling into the caves; Sarah trying avoid the camera.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This is good. An entry point. We get this to the surface. This’1l give a rescue team a focus.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Leave the others?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’re not leaving anyone. Rios fast-forwards, stopping at intervals to see...

dialogues.speaker: ONSCREEN- -
dialogues.text: The women marvel at a large cave. Rebecca free-climbs the ravine. Then the FOOTAGE turns to snow.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Is that it? The FOOTAGE returns. In NIGHT VISION. It shows a cave in which bright-white picked-clean bones line the floor

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAVE--
dialogues.text: Rios looks around. This is really creeping her out.

dialogues.speaker: ONSCREEN- -
dialogues.text: The women chatter to each other, scared...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Dead animals. Hundreds of them.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: This is not good, guys.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Can we get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Come on... (lights a zippo) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAVE- -
dialogues.text: Dan and Rios watch the video with dread anticipation.  47. A noise. A CLICK. Rios sweeps her flashlight round, edgy. Nothing. They turn back to the SCREEN-- The women on the video are getting extremely scared. The night-vision shows faces in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: There’s no breeze. It could be any one of these tunnels. Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Oh Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Hello? Is there anybody there?!! The camera pans back to Beth... Behind her is a CRAWLER! The women scream, scatter, the Crawler disappears into shadow...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAVE--
dialogues.text: Dan and Rios jump.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: What the-

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rewind it. Rewind! As Rios fumbles with the Camcorder, trying to rewind, the light spill illuminates A CRAWLER. Right behind them! ! The Crawler HISSES. Dan and Rios gasp. Rios drops the camcorder They scatter into the dark. Hide. Rios hunkers down behind a large rock, her eyes straining into the darkness. Dan, hyper-alert, listens out for the danger.  48. Their torches cut the cave, looking for danger. The camcorder still plays on the ground: the disorientate terrified girls call to each other

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: It’s circling us.

dialogues.speaker: SAM, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: It’s here somewhere. Fuck, it’s there- In an eerie echo, Dan and Rios don’t know where the dange lurks in the dark. Neither dare move. Rios reaches for her holster. But her gun’s not there. They call out to each other tentatively in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Dan? Dan, where are you? Rios stiffens, hearing SCUTTLING.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy? Deputy, you okay? CLICK. CLICK. The crawler stalks them somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I’m over here. The CAMCORDER’S LCD SCREEN casts a ghostly glow: in nightvision, it plays the crawler attack; shows Crawlers disembowelling Holly’s corpse. It gives Dan an idea.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy, stay there. Kill your light. He fumbles towards the camcorder- which lies nearer to Ri BREATHING POV: Rios’s back, stalked... Rios, blinking in the dark. Utterly blind. Senses somethi

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Dan? That you? Dan?  49. A pale, bloody hand grabs Rios from behind...A hand claws round Rios’s mouth. A sharp bone to her throat. It’s Sarah. She pulls Rios down. Covers her mouth. Rios resists. Sarah presses her piton to Rios’s throat. Rios stops resisting. In the dim light cast by the nearby camcorder, Rios sees crawler in front of her, stalking her... Sarah holds her still, silent.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy? The crawler senses its prey. Turns. Towards Dan’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy? And Sarah lets it go. Rios is forced to watch the fatal convergence.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Deputy, you okay? I’m nearly there. Sarah holds tight. Not alerting him. Not silencing him. Sentencing him to death. Grabbing the camcorder, Dan stops the playback. Fiddles t change the mode to nightvision. He scans the camera round...

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Okay Deputy, I can see- NIGHTVISION GREEN SCREEN: Rios. Her eyes wide and white. Rios, held silent hostage by Sarah. Gasps. Something POPS into the foreground of his screen. A CRAWLER. JAWS WIDE, COMING RIGHT AT HIM... Sharp teeth sever Dan’s jugular and vocal chords. He lets horrible wet harking gasps for air and for help. The dying Dan starts to crawl towards Sarah and Rios. Pul himself along on his back with the little strength he’s g Rios looks to Sarah. Sarah holds still, steely. No choice to let him die.  50. His hand reaches Sarah just as the Crawler rips open his belly. The Crawler looks up from Dan, tilts its head, senses the air. CLICK. CLICK. Sensing in Rios and Sarah’s direction. It edges towards them. Sarah and Rios stay stock-still. Silent. Terrified. Sarah stares at the Crawler. Rios breathes fast and shall behind Sarah’s hand as they both watch the Crawler...move away . The Crawler CLICKS again. Faint CLICKS come in reply from down a TUNNEL. The Crawler turns. Leaves down the TUNNEL. It’s gone. Sarah releases Rios, who rushes over to Dan. Her training kicks in: she pushes his innards back into his belly; tri to stem the blood pumping from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Come on, Dan. Hold on. (to Sarah) Help me. Sarah watches her. But Dan’s finally gone. Rios looks at Dan in horror. Then at Sarah in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: You just let him die. Sarah shrugs past her, works fast: she strips Dan of his and equipment. Rios watches, appalled at Sarah’s ruthlessness. Sarah tools up, pockets Dan’s flares, flashlight, the camcorder. Takes the LAMINATED MINE MAPS. Secures Dan’s b around her own waist. Slots his pick in it. She stands, gives Rios a last look, moves towards a TUNNE the far end of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop!  51. Sarah stops by Beth’s corpse. Stares down at Beth. Stares back at Rios..

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: How can you be so fucking cold? Sarah says nothing. Doesn’t move. Rios realises why: two Crawlers have entered the CAVE. Rios shuts up. Freezes. Will the same thing happen again with Rios as Sarah’s escape bait this time? As softly as she can, Rios creeps closer to Sarah. Across the cave, Sarah stands stock still. The crawlers stand between them. Finally, the Crawlers turn away, rush Dan’s body. Snarlin one another, they slowly drag him from the CAVE (in the direction Dan and Rios entered). They’re gone. Taking Beth’s pick, Sarah is already halfway up the TUNNE Faced with being alone in this hell, Rios scuttles to kee up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath tries to build a support wall from the stones to han something to buy her enough time to wriggle free. It’s fiddly work in cramped conditions. Just as she wedge an anchoring stone, her wall collapses, threatening to br down the rocks above her. Suffering the psychological torment of another near miss Cath sighs a deep breath. She tries to inch her way out. But the creaking rock abov enough to deter her. She tries her radio.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Dan? Dan you there? Anybody there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines stumbles over rocks. Splashes through water. Reach another junction, he spins round, aware he is lost. Alone  52.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Rios? Rios, you read me? (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: CAN ANYBODY HEAR ME
dialogues.text: He slumps against the wall, closes his eyes, puts his han his heart/badge.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: I, Redmond Bertram Vaines, do solemnly swear to protect and serve the community. (opens his eyes) To protect and serve. He gets up, soldiers on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios struggles to keep up with Sarah. Suddenly Sarah stop Faces Rios. Fierce with pick in hand. She points over Rios’s shoulder at water dripping off the wall. As Sarah moves off after the water course, Rios sighs rel scurries after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath starts rebuilding her support wall. Stops. She hears something in the dark. Movement.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Hello? HELP! HELP! DAN! DAN, THAT YOU. I’M OVER HERE. No reply.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: (ON RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, is that you? No reply. Then a faint CLICKING. Cath flashes her light, trying to attract attention.

dialogues.speaker: HELP. PLEASE. OVER HERE.
dialogues.text: There’s definitely someone there.  53. Cath strains her neck, peers through a chink in the rock. A CRAWLER EYE glares back at her. She jolts back in shot. The eye has gone. The Crawler’s vanished. Terrified, Cath sweeps her flashlight round. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: It’s just the dark. The dark fucks with your head. It’s not real. Then the crawler comes back- with a vengeance. At her feet. Fighting to find a way through the rubble to at her. Reaching its arm through the rubble at her. Clawing at he Champing at her. Cath tries to fight it off. Kicking, scuffling. Nowhere t go. Every defensive move risks bringing the rocks down on her. Cath faces an impossible choice: either the crawler get her- or she’1l be crushed. The crawler burrows closer, working its way for her neck. As the crawler lunges, Cath risks everything, moving shar slamming a rock into its face. It falls hard. Into her support wall. Becoming its last piece. As the crawler’s body takes the weight of the rocks above Cath seizes her opportunity, wriggles hard... First crawler ribs start to snap...Then it’s skull starts splitting... Cath crawls for her life. She just squeezes out the narro gap. Grabs for her trailing flashlight as- CRUNCH and CRACK- the crawler’s skull shatters and bones the crushing rocks make powder of its bones and paste of flesh. Cath fills her lungs, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shallow stream moves down the centre of the tunnel.  54. Sarah stares at the shimmering surface of the water. She spits into it, determining the direction of its current. Follows it. Rios following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cath, still panicked, charges through the tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Dan, Dan you there? Please Dan. She stops suddenly. Her torch beam REVEALS: Recessed shelves gouged out of the tunnel wall. Cath edges to a shelf. Directs her light towards- A_ skeleton. Cath jumps in shock. The skeleton is seemingly human. Laid out on the shelf as in a coffin. Moving down the TUNNEL, Cath shines her light into the ot shelves. Finds dozens of skeletons. Then more recent corp Flesh traces still cling to the bones. Beyond them are freshly excavated shelves. Scratch marks round their entrances. She nears one. Shines her light in Comes face to face... With a Crawler! Cath jumps back. She fights to rein in her fear. What the hell is this? But the Crawler doesn’t move. It’s dead. A hole in its forehead. Cath looks into the shelf above. Finds another dead Crawl All the skeletons are Crawlers, not humans. This is some sort of CRAWLER CATACOMB. She looks back to the second dead Crawler. Its eyes have gouged out. (These are the Crawlers Sarah and Juno killed Amidst the bodies, one moves. Cath tucks herself away.  55. Terrified, she raises her pick to defend herself. The crawler closes in, coming from the corner. Cath readies to strike-

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Greg- Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Cath!

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: We thought you were- what happened?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: One of these freaks attacked. I just ran.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: You ran? Greg struggles to bear his deep shame.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Have you seen any of the others?

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: I’ve been on my own. I thought I was going mad. Oh, God, Cath, it’s good to see you. Cath slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Greg, get a grip. CLI-- CLI-- CLICK-- A conversation-killer. A Crawler MURMUR comes from the tunnel beyond. Soft. Low. Like weeping. Through the catacombs they see A FEMALE CRAWLER. The Craw has a swollen belly. It’s pregnant. Next to the Pregnant Crawler is a Crawler corpse. The Pregnant Crawler washes water over the corpse from a near pool. Cleans it tenderly. Emitting soft clicks. Mourning. Around her, a FUNERAL PARTY of grieving crawlers. Cath and Greg back away.  56. Cath points to a far exit. Their only way out Past the mourning crawler mother. Greg shakes his head. Cath nods. It’s the only way. Greg tiptoes towards the exit on the far side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines hears FAINT MOVEMENT again. He swings his light. F nothing. Heartbeat rising, he moves to a TUNNEL JUNCTION. Directs his beam into each tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: DRIP DRIP DRIP
dialogues.text: Something oozes onto Vaines’ shoulder. Vaines touches the substance. Holds it to his light... Viscous liquid. Just then, a SHADOW moves behind Vaines. Sensing movement, Vaines spins... An arm swings towards him from the ceiling. Hits his face Vaines flails back, terrified. Veers his light up. Finds- Dan’s dead body hanging upside down from a crack in the ceiling. Eviscerated. Vaines stumbles, fights down his urge to gag. He draws his gun, hand shaking.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Jesus. With shaking hands, Vaines reaches for Dan’s radio. But a grabs it, Dan’s body falls. Vaines leaps away. His pulse racing, Vaines unclips Dan’s radio...

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Can anyone hear me? Dan’s dead. Sarah Carter’s killed him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Cath, tantalisingly close to the exit when...

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: ...Greg..? Cath..? ...You hear..? Dan’s... dead... kill...  57. The Funeral Crawlers raises their heads. HISS.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (OVER WALKIE-TALKIE)
dialogues.text: Come i... Greg. Co... in. Cath snaps off her radio. Hardly dares look... Greg’s eyes search round. Meet Cath’s.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and Cath run for their lives... They hit a dead end. They have to turn back They hear crawlers coming. There’s nowhere to go. Down the tunnel, crawlers click, sensing the air... But Cath and Greg have gone. The crawlers stop, sensing out their victims. High above, wedged back to back, with their feet pressed either side of the wall [a climber’s hold] Cath and Greg strain to keep still and silent Finally, the crawlers scuttle past... Greg and Cath drop down. Cath desperately tries her radio.

dialogues.speaker: CATH, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Anyone there? Chief Vaines? This is Cath? You there? Come in. Lonely static crackle. Despair consumes her.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Dan’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: We don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: I know what I heard.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: It wasn’t clear.  58.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Vaines had his radio.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Whoever it was, he can’t be far. We got a signal. We gotta find them. Cath’s facade quivers, cracks.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Hold me Greg. They cling tight.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: You won’t run out on me.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Out there, on my own, I was so scared. Together- we’re a team. CLICK. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: There’s more of them.

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Come on. They charge off through the tunnel. Glimpsing Crawlers giving chase. Hearing their horrible SCUTTLINGS as they pursue them through... Tapering tunnels, sharp turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop just as suddenly. Teetering on the edge of a GO with a vertiginous drop below. As Cath moves her light back up, she illuminates... SAM. [From the first film.] Dead. Still hanging upside down from a rope in the rock ceiling One of her arms is missing - the shoulder is chewed to th bone. Her innards are spilled over her sides. Cath lurches back in horror. Greg looks at Cath, looks ba into the tunnel they came down. SCUFFLING.  59. Ahead, a deadly drop. Cath scans the roof for a route. Sa rope snakes back through pitons along the roof. Greg thinks fast, slams a piton into their near wall, loo the rope through it, pulls it taut. [The gravity of Sam’s bodyweight tugs the other end tight. ]

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Gets us halfway. (raising his pick) I’1l hold them off. They lock eyes. Greg looks determined to make amends. Cath sets out, hand over hand. Cath makes it to Sam. Her decaying body a sticky, putrid, maggot-ridden obstacle. Cath slides down. Cath climbs up the body, hooking her pick in Sam’s ribs a hold. Reaching the roof, she hooks in another piton. Secu a secondary rope to it. Behind Greg, CLICKING and SCUFFLING. Crawlers closing...

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Greg. Cath tosses the rope back. Just as the crawlers crowd him, Greg swings... Swings across the cavern, slamming into the far side. Gripping hard, he claws his way onto the far ledge. Sees a crawler climbs across the rope towards Cath who dangles, vulnerable, like a fly on a spider web, caught between the crawlers and Greg.

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Cath. Throw me the rope. I’1l secure it. Cath! But she doesn’t. Instead she pulls her pick

dialogues.speaker: CATH
dialogues.text: Run. Run!

dialogues.speaker: GREG
dialogues.text: Cath, no. But Cath turns to fights the crawler. Swinging with her p The pitons strain under the triple weight of Sam, Cath an the crawler.  60. Greg’s fixing on the crawler side wall shifts, POPS. Greg can only watch as Cath, Sam and the crawler fall 50 feet...

dialogues.speaker: INTO A WATER POOL
dialogues.text: The fight continues. Underwater, as the water turns red, light source dies in the water... Greg is alone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Rios follow the stream - which is now deeper. A the end of the TUNNEL the water tumbles down step-like ro into an OVULAR cave.... Sarah climbs down the rock steps. Rios slips. Follows. Water flows in from side passages to form a pool. Sarah looks into the pool- sees a CRAWLER’S FACE where he reflection should be... She spins round to attack it... But it’s only Rios there. Rios thinks she’s being attacke Until she sees... The CRAWLER emerges from UNDER the water... Sarah spins round in time to bury a pick into its neck. Killing it. Sarah looks around, her senses attuned to the possibility reinforcements... At the far-end of the cave, water drains slowly into a TU that’s almost entirely submerged. There’s only a GAP of a foot between the water and the ceiling. Sarah wades in. Heads towards the SUBMERGED TUNN

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: We’re not going in that? Sarah gives her a look: she’s going; it’s up to her if sh follows. Sarah wades on, the water now up to her chest Desperately unhappy, Rios follows. It’s freezing, but Rio forces herself in deeper and deeper.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines stares into the dark ahead. Then from the TUNNEL behind, Vaines hears MOVEMENT. He spins his light into th TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hello? Somebody there? Show yourself. Just beyond his light, Vaines senses more movement. Nothing. Adrenaline rising, Vaines moves into the TUNNEL. Breathing POV: Vaines shine his flashlight round, unaware he’s being watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Rios move down the TUNNEL. Their helmets scrape roof. Only their heads are out the water. Rios’s on the v of outright panic. Ahead they see that the roof dips dramatically into the water. It looks like a solid wall.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: It’s a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The water’s flowing. There’s a way through. (beat ) I’m not going to wait for you.
