dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: No please, wait, please. I can’t...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (cold) It’s all in your head. And Sarah disappears into the water. Rios watches, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: No! Oh God... Oh God... Rios tries to summon up enough courage to follow Sarah. She takes a deep, sobbing breath. Dives down.  62.

Rios’s helmet lamp illuminates suspended silt. Her hands search down, down. Rios finds a way forward... It’s a TIGHT LETTERBOX TUNNEL. She contorts into it. Grap along, her air running out Eventually the space opens up. She scrabbles upwards in desperation. Her head comes above water into a...

dialogues.speaker: VERY LOW BREATHE-SPACE- -
dialogues.text: Rios’s helmet hits the roof. Only her eyes are above the surface. She sees Sarah’s face tilted, so that her nose a mouth are just out the water. Rios copies Sarah. Gulps air.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Lose the helmet. Sarah shines her flashlight ahead. The roof dips down aga

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And don’t think. Sarah takes off her helmet. Moves backwards, face upwards Now there’s only an inch above the surface. Rios copies h Rios and Sarah’s noses brush the ceiling for a few horren metres, their eyes wide in the murky water. Finally the roof rises, giving them several inches of bre space. Rios’s shivering. Terror-stricken. They put their helmets back on. Move further. Come to another wall.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: No. Please not again... Sarah just takes a breath. Ducks into the water. Disappea into the gloom. Rios chokes back her dread, takes deep breaths. Ducks dow into the water too.

Rios feels the rock with her hands. Finds a way through. Scrambles through the churned gritty water. The gap opens up, wider, higher. A new chamber. Rios swims up to the surface... But there is no surface.  63. There’s no breathe-space at all. She just comes up agains rock. She smacks the roof with her hands in disbelief. Bubbles escape her mouth. She looks round, realises she h to keep going... She dives deeper, her lungs aching. Frantically pulls her under another dip in the rock. Clawing through. Running o of air fast. Gradually the rock above her rises. She swim upwards. Hoping there’1ll be air. Finally she surfaces. I

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER AIR POCKET
dialogues.text: This new chamber is small. Tight. Only her head is above water. She gulps air. But now, looking round, she realise

dialogues.speaker: ES
dialogues.text: he’s alone.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah? Sarah! Rios looks round, treading water, not knowing what to do. hivering, her breathing reverberates. Water laps into her jouth, makes her cough. Her fear and desperation rise fas Bon

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Oh fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows she’s going to die in here. That she’1l drown never to be found. And then she sees... A shadow moving under the water towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios shifts away from it, terrified. BUBBLES pop on the water’s surface. The shadow rises.
From the POV of whatever’s coming for her, we see Rios’s and legs flailing. A pale arm reaches out. Grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BREATHE-SPACE- -
dialogues.text: Rios screams. Thrashes around to get free. And then the t surfaces next to her. Rios screams. Then realises... It’s Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: (clings to Sarah) You came back.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Save your breath. Sarah dives down, pulling Rios with her...  64.
Together they move through the water, following the rock it dips down, then corkscrews left and right. It’s extrem tight. But Sarah pulls Rios along. They move upwards into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Rios surface in a long pool, fill their lungs w air. The water flows towards the far point of the pool. Sarah wades forward. Sees that the water is being sucked a tight crack in the rock. Not even big enough to get an through. There’s no way to track the water onward.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No... Her emotionless face breaks. She smacks the rock blocking escape. Then pulls herself out onto rocks at the side.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: There’s no way through? That’s it? Sarah doesn’t respond. Shivering, Rios looks round. She’s willing to give up. Three walls meet at the cave’s apex. There’s a rough “window” halfway up a wall that leads to PASSAGEWAY .

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: There must be a way. You found a way! Sarah, downcast, runs her hand through the-

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Water.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I thought you’d left me. No response. Rios pulls out her cellphone to bring up a p of Emily.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: This is my daughter. No response. Rios slips around a rock, switches her phone into the VIDEO RECORDER application.  65. She tries to compose herself, to look happy. Then she tur the camera on herself, RECORDS...

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Luz, this is mummy. I just want you to know how much I love you. How proud I am. What a lovely girl you are. You be good and kind and caring. You live a good life. Te quiero, te estrafio... As Rios’s voice cracks, Sarah listens. Something in her softens... Rios tries to compose herself, returns around the rock offers the phone to Sarah. Sarah shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: My daughter died.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She was my world. There’s a sympathy here. Suddenly illuminated in the opposite corner of the cave - across the water - is JESSICA, with her birthday cake. Sa melts. But then makes a decision to look away. She looks to where Jessica was sitting. Jessica is gone. Rios has watched all of this with slight alarm. Sarah takes out the maps from her belt, nods up at the ‘window’ in the rock above.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Vent shafts. All deep mines have them to get air to the miners. If we can follow a seam, break back through into the mine, find one of these shafts-

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: What’s the scale of this map?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg struggles on, cold, thirsty, alone. Behind him, CLICK...CLICK, something stirs. Greg spins round, arcs his flashlight... Something is stalking him, scurrying in the shadows... He lights a flare, throws it...Hoping to scare them off. As Greg retreats, the hot light of the flare casts shadow CRAWLERS. Two of them. Nosferatu was never so sinister. Greg’s seen enough. Runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg bolts in blind panic. But he’s not as fast as his pursuers. Closing on him in the dark... They jump on his back. Maul him. One sinks its teeth into torso. Greg shrieks. The other scratches at his legs. Greg kicks and swats and bats them off. Finally Greg gets a good look at his attackers. Their shadows made them look bigger than they are. Two TWINS. They’re so small that Greg just stares bewildered. These little Crawlers seem almost cute. Then both twins SNARL viciously, showing razor teeth.

dialogues.speaker: FUCK THIS. YOU LITTLE FUCKS
dialogues.text: All this fears and frustrations fuse into RAGE. The TWINS regroup. They’re not adept at hunting yet, but they’re learning fast. They close in on Greg. TWIN 1 leaps onto his back, rips into his arm as TWIN 2 c at his face. Greg knocks Twin 2 away to the floor.  67. He backs hard against the wall- winding Twin 1. But it ho on tight. Spinning, Greg sees a sharp rocky outcrop, back hard into it. Impaling the creature. It falls off. Dead. Enraged, Twin 2 launches at Greg. Sinks it’s teeth into h Its teeth still sunk in his arm, Greg bashes its head aga the wall...again and again, till it falls... Then, in his bloodlust, he stamps on its head. Makes crus watermelon of its skull... Greg stumbles back, shocked, exhausted. He looks down at the dead TWINS. Takes in what he’s just done. Catches his breath. Wipes the blood from his face. SLAM!!! A FEMALE CRAWLER sideswipes Greg from out of nowh Then it looks from the dead TWINS to Greg, furious. But Greg’s done with running. He’s not going down without fight. As the Crawler advances, Greg holds his ground. He pulls the drill from his belt. His finger on the trigg At the last minute, he turns it on, thrusting its spirall bit towards the Crawler... The WHIRRING NOISE fills the Tunnel. But the Crawler hears it coming. Swipes it away. Greg turns, swinging the drill round. But the Crawler is faster, sinks its jaws into him. Bites hand off at the wrist. Greg’s hand - still holding the spinning drill - falls to ground. SLASH. The crawler slashes Greg’s tendons. He finds himself falling, face-first... Towards the spinning drill bit, clamped in his own finger THRRRR-SSSS. He drills through his own eye. Dead.  68. The Female Crawler attends to the bodies of the dead TWIN She tilts her head and emits a keening SCREECH. A mother’ tragedy - a call to arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Rios hear the PRIMAL SCREECH echo. They exchang worried look. Hurry to a hole in the rock. Rios hesitates staring into the extremely tight hole.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Moved here for the wide, open spaces. Sarah looks back. A hint of a smile. Sarah contorts herself into the tiny TUNNEL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a terrible, claustrophobic place. Sarah advances wit difficulty. Rios squeezes in. Crawls along. Fighting her fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaines presses on. Hearing MOVEMENT behind him, he spins... A FIGURE shifts quickly into darkness. But as Vaines aims his light, the figure’s gone. Vaines settles his beam on a SMALL OPENING low in the roc He pulls his gun, ducks down. Inches into the OPENING. Shines his light inside... It’s a DARK TUNNEL. Vaines squints into the darkness, sca his flashlight at... Two eyes, glaring back SLAM! The FIGURE launches at Vaines, who tries to fight i off. But it’s too fast and strong. It pins Vaines down. Flashe climbing axe. Vaines stares up in fear.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Juno!  69. It is JUNO. Axe raised. Filthy, feral, her face half-ripp away .

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re here to rescue you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah and Rios continue their belly-crawl. Sarah contorts herself through a kink in the rock. Rios catches her hip. Twists. Wedging herself tighter. He breathing gets bigger. Sarah twists herself, reaches a hand back.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Luz, that means light?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She boss you around?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: When did she last boss you around?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: She wanted shoes like her friend Lottie’s. With flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Did you buy them?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Smiles. With Sarah’s help, Rios relaxes enough to ease through the kink.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stick with those shoes. They’1ll get you out. Then Sarah’s helmet light picks something up ahead of the

dialogues.speaker: A CRAWLER
dialogues.text: It’s several metres ahead, blocking their way. It licks w off the rock, oblivious to Sarah and Rios’s presence.  70. Sarah tries to tease out her pick, but as she moves, the Crawler lifts its head. CLICKS. Sensing... Sarah freezes. Rios hears the CLICKS. Panics.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: We can’t go back. We can’t turn. And then, ahead of them, a RAT emerges from a hole in the floor of the tunnel. The hole is covered with WEBS and DI but the rat pushes through. Sniffs. Sarah stares at the hole. The only way out now? The rat scuttles towards Sarah’s face. Sniffs at her open eyes. Sarah can’t help but flinch. Startled, the rat SQUE The Crawler reacts instantly. Stares RIGHT at Sarah with dead eyes. Sarah stares back. She has no choice... She moves as fast as she can. Right at the Crawler.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah!? But the Crawler’s coming at them. It’s a race to the HOLE Sarah gets there first. She pushes through the webs. A “chimney” leads straight down. But its walls are moving.. It’s alive with BUGS. Sarah cracks a flare. Throws it at the Crawler, who instinctively rears back. Sarah dives into the BUG HOLE. As Sarah disappears, the Crawler SCREECHES at Rios. But i kept at bay by the fizzing flare. Rios shuffles faster. D headfirst into the BUG HOLE. But the Crawler catches her trailing ankle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls heave with insects. They cover Rios’s face and body. Scurry into her hair and clothes. Rios screams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crawler grapples with Rios’s leg. But her boot comes in its hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios falls head-first. Through BUGS. Falls and falls...  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lands in a mire of putrid sludge. Rios’s in a LONG LO CAVE with many exits. She stands, hysterically brushing insects off herself as Sarah watches.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: It’s on me! It’s on me! SMACK! From the hole above, The Crawler lands on Rios. Plunging her back into the sludge. Sarah moves fast. BAM! Sarah buries her pick into the Crawler’s face with a her might. Then levers the pick so it tears through the Crawler’s brain. The Crawler screams in agony. Sarah plunges the pick into the Crawler’s chest. Twists. Blood spurts. Bones crack. The Crawler’s history. Sarah yanks her pick free, then notices Rios staring at h stunned. Sarah realises what she must look like. Then Sarah senses something close. CLICKING. Sarah grabs Rios. Pulls her down into the SLUDGE again - that they are almost submerged. A Crawler comes into the cave, CLICKING. It crouches at the edge of the cave... And shits into the sludge. Adding to it. Rios watches, repulsed, realising what she’s neck-deep in The Crawler finishes its shit. Leaves the cave. Sarah helps Rios up. Rios spits out a mouthful of sludge. Picks up her lost boot from beneath the dead Crawler. Pou glop out from it. They share grimaces: it’s almost comically bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno demolishes a power bar from Vaines’s supplies. Vaine dresses her leg wound, clearly somewhat wary of her feral manic manner.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: This is a knife wound-

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: A pick.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Sarah Carter did this?  72. Juno looks at her- how did he know?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: We found Sam and Rebecca’s bodies. And she attacked my deputy. Got away .

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You brought her back down here?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: She was the only lead we had- fucking maze down here- Did she kill them all? Holly? Beth? Juno, remembering that SHE killed Beth, hesitates, focuss on replacing the batteries in her helmet light.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: What did she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Crazy shit, creatures, monsters. Just babbling. Was it the dark? Or the drugs? CLICK. CLICK. Juno suddenly freezes. Wide-eyed. Silent. Staring past Vaines. A CLICKING sound comes from behind h Vaines turns. Squints into the shadows at the far end of cave... Slowly a figure steps through Vaines’ light, coming towar them. Vaines stares at the Crawler in utter disbelief. Stunned, Vaines turns back to Juno. But she has gone. Vai looks round, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Juno? The Crawler CLICKS, sensing Vaines. Vaines looks back at the approaching Crawler. But it has slipped back into the dark He flashes his flashlight around, desperate to locate the threat... Nothing...  73. From nowhere, the Crawler HISSES in Vaines’ face. Bares i teeth... Juno drops from the ceiling onto the Crawler. Buries her into the side of the Crawler’s head, levers its handle do crunching the blade up through bone and brain. The Crawler splutters. Dead. Juno pulls her axe out, stands up. Wipes the axe on her thigh. Vaines stares at her. Stares at the dead creature.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Death. Juno barks a dark laugh at Vaines’s stunned state. He poi to her injured leg.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: But they didn’t do that?

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) They were coming for us. She sawa way to survive.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hell of a friend-

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Friendship is weakness. (smearing herself with blood) You want to live? Think like an animal. Lose your human scent. Lose all human traces. Get like them. Move like them. Kill like them. Vaines eyes her warily: this is not a woman to watch your back. He dips his fingers in the blood. INT. “STAIRCASE” CAVE - DARKNESS Sarah and Rios climb up large flat rocks. They move quick efficiently. Working as a team. Sarah can see a marked ch in Rios. She’s toughened. They move onwards. Into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rock glistens. Minerals catch in Rios’s light as she climbs up out of a crack in the wall. Sarah’s right behin

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Look, like the mine. We must be close... They share a smile of camaraderie. Keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juno and Vaines move through the labyrinthine caves in silence: Juno staggers on her leg, winces in pain. They reach a JUNCTION.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ maze- Taking a breath, Juno catches her reflection in the blade her pick: she puts her hand to her face. She looks haunted by herself, then her face hardens as sh sees-

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Bootprints. Juno measures the print against her boot. Marginally bigg

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: I know she left you for dead. But when we find her, don’t you be thinking about any payback. Justice is my job. Juno says nothing. Her eyes trouble Vaines. She scrambles off, after the trail. Vaines scrambles after her-- INT. “FOREST” CAVE - DARKNESS Juno and Vaines crisscross between thick stalagmites that up like tree trunks. Juno leads, her eyes constantly shifting. She sees someth on the floor, she quickly bends to look at it Another BOOTPRINT. She changes direction and moves off.  75. Vaines moves after her, jumpy, alert to every shadow. Crawler CLICKS echo nearby. Juno freezes.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: What do we-

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Shut up. Juno closes her eyes. The CLICKS come again. Juno angles head, listening, sensing. She looks to a PASSAGE to her left. Then towards another PASSAGE on the right. Her eyes narrow. She grabs Vaines. Pulls him to a wall. P her pick to his neck. A CRAWLER appears from behind a trunk. It CLICKS and sens Vaines breathes erratically. The approaching Crawler sear the ‘forest’. Juno glares at Vaines to control his breath. The Crawler edges closer. Searching the walls. It advances on Juno and Vaines. CLICK in their faces. Jun like stone. Vaines is desperately tries to stead breath and stay stil sweat beading his upper lip. He edges his gun from its holster. Juno shakes her head. Droplets of piss DRIP onto his boots... The crawler turns slowly towards him, smells the air... CLICKING mouth millimetres from Vaines’ wide eyes. Juno strikes. Bites deep into the crawler’s throat. Rips spits out its larynx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crawler drops dead. Vaines stares in shock at Juno’s blood-smeared mouth. He fights against retching. Juno raises a hand, silencing him, sensing MOVEMENT at th far end of the forest. They freeze. Listen.  76. Stalagmites block Juno’s lines of sight. She edges forward cautiously. Axe raised. The MOVEMENT comes again. Her nerves wound tight, Juno works from “trunk” to “trunk She sweeps her light round. Shifts to a new stalagmite. Vaines follows her, terrified. Juno hears something SCRABBLE behind the stalagmite ahead She raises her pick. Psyches herself. Creeps slowly round Then spins out from behind the “trunk”. Launches the pick towards-- Nothing. There’s nothing there. Glimpses movement behind her, reflected in her pick. She spins. Swings her pick, just as another axe hurtles at Ju own face. Sparks fly as the two axes INTERLOCK. Sarah. Juno stares at Sarah as if she’s seen a ghost Juno stares right back. For several seconds, neither speak. Sarah’s icy eyes meet Juno’s fiery gaze. They stand: gunslingers before the dra prizefighters before the bell... Rios and Vaines, ring-side, look to each other, lost Something in their faces stops Vaines stepping in. Sarah and Juno face off, struggling with raging emotions.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Girls, that’s enough. Kiss and make up. We don’t have the time. He might as well be mute.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: HEY! You hear me. I’m in charge here.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: In what way? He has no answer.  77. Juno raises her axe...then strikes... Releasing it like a tomahawk. Past Sarah’s shoulder... SLAM! Into the skull of [the earlier] CRAWLER that lurks behind her. It falls, DEAD. Juno barges past Sarah, retrieves her weapon. Looks aroun her, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: So you’re the rescue party. (beat ) So what’s the plan? Silence. No one has a plan. She picks up a skull, tosses it to Vaines.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You ever thought, when we’re not here, what do they eat? Where do they hunt?

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: This is a stag’s skull. They hunt above ground?

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: And you know how they get there? (Juno nods) So let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If you know how they get out, how come you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: (points to Sarah’s ropes) I had no ropes. And no climbing partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble along, struggling to keep their footing. Sa leads, far from comfortable with Juno on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’m watching your back.  78. Behind them, Rios scans the thermal imaging camera. Vulnerable at the back, Vaines.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Listen Rios, we gotta watch ourselves. Don’t know which of the two mad bitches is worse.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Three mad bitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave floor is dangerously unsecure: deep collapsed ho in places, a thin crust of rock in others. Juno, in the lead, tests the ground in front of her, prod it with her pick handle. It smashes straight through the crust, revealing an endless deep drop below.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Stop! Floor’s unsecure. Test every footfall. Walk in each other’s steps. They edge along their precarious path: it’s like walking the crust of a creme brulee. It’s like mine-sweeping: eve footstep slow and perilous. Just then Crawler CLICKS come from behind them. Vaines - at the rear - glances back into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re coming. Move it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, keep it steady. CLICK...CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: We’re nearly through. Vaines can’t bear this mine-field speed. Presses against ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chief, slow and steady.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: You’re not at the back. Behind, his light picks up moving shadows.  79. Vaines fights every instinct to go fast. Loses the battle Hurrying to get past, Vaines goes off route, puts a foot wrong. Loses it through the floor. His foot stuck fast, h struggles to get it out.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Don’t move. Stay still. Rios tries to pull him out. Sarah and Juno come to help. As they tug, the wrenching GROAN of a crack opening up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s no good. The floor will give way.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: We can’t leave him. Vaines reads ruthlessness in Sarah’s look: he knows she l Juno. And he’s no friend to her. Vaines grabs her tight, grapples her. They struggle. Sara pulls her arm away. Only to find that Vaines has cuffed her wrist to his.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Get. Me. Out. Sarah reaches for his keys. They tussle. The crack widens... Then the ground buckles under his bodyweight, cracking op to reveal a deep vertical fissure in the rock Vaines tumbles into the sheer shaft, held dangling from S by the cuffs, pulling her over the ledge with him. Rios grabs her legs. Juno reaches out for Vaines. It takes all three of him ju to stop him falling.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Pull me out. But he’s too heavy- they can’t pull him up. From deep below, in the darkness, CLICKING...

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Quiet! Stay still!  80. In the deep darkness, SCRABBLING.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: No, get me out! They’re coming! Sarah looks down past Vaines: figures emerge from the bla below. Two crawlers.

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Come on! Rios and Juno strain to yank Vaines out. He’s too heavy. Below him, Crawlers are closing fast up out of the dark

dialogues.speaker: VAINES
dialogues.text: Hurry! A First Crawler closes in. A Second Crawler right behind The first crawler jumps on Vaines’s back, using his flesh claw holds. Vaines SCREAMS. The crawler instantly doubles the downward weight, tuggin Vaines back into the shaft, pulling Sarah down wit him. R holds tight. But they are all being pulled into the precipice. The second crawler grabs at Vaines’s legs. Gnawing at his boots. Tripling the weight. SLUMP. They all slip back further. Vaines screams louder. Blood bursts from his mouth. As Vaines is pulled backwards, Sarah clings to a rock, wi her free hand to anchor herself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The keys. Realising he’s fucked, Vaines fumbles for the keys. Finally gets them. But the first crawler BITES into his arm. He drops the keys. They fall into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno! Juno realises immediately what Sarah’s asking her to do.  81. She glances at Vaines, overrun by crawlers, realising he’ going to die. Juno raises her pick.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Juno! Please. Juno has to lean down into the shaft to have a shot. It puts her directly in Vaines’s eyeline. He watches in horror as Juno aims the pick at his wrist. The collective weight shifts further back. One more pull Sarah’s gone too...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Juno slams the pick into Vaines’ wrist Vaines SCREAMS hideously. Rios watches on in shock. But Juno hacks again. And again. Through skin, sinew bone gristle, tendons. There are eight bones and four joints i the wrist. It’s bloody, grisly work. Again, Vaines is pulled harder, tendons strain, rip. Last tendon. Blood down him. Crawler on throat-- pulling them down. Juno has one last shot. A final sinew stretches and snaps as... Vaines falls away. The crawlers fall with him. Disappearing down into the dark Sarah hangs free. They hoist her up over the lip. Vaines’s severed hand dangles from her cuffs. Disgusted Sarah tries to shake it free. It remains persistently in place: takes some effort to get it loose. They back away from the drop. Sarah meets Juno’s eye. Nod something approximating thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Which way?  82. Juno points.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Wait. There’s something I didn’t tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, Juno and Rios peer round a corner in a TUNNEL, pee round the corner into... A wide, domed chamber. An awful cacophony of raspy wet CHEWING. Wherever Rios aims her thermal imaging camera, it reveals heat blobs. Dozens of heat blobs. Each one a live crawler hardly any floorspace between them, tearing at their fres slaughtered prey- both animal and human.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: It’s where they eat. Juno points to the far side of the chamber: a tunnel wet blood from where slaughtered creatures have been brought. To get there, they have to SWIM through the BLOODPOOL [wh run-off blood collects] that runs along the side of the chamber. Rios shakes her head: is Juno mad? Juno nods. It’s the only way. Sarah and Juno hold a long look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them slip into the blood pool... The stench is horrendous. The sounds are worse: disgustin glimpses wet LIPSMACKS, CHOMPING, TEARING, CHEWING. They wade through the pool...slow, claggy progress They communicate with hands and heads: Stop; Go; That way A discarded bone SPLASHES between them. A false alarm. They press on. All too aware of their prospective fate. Finally they climb out of the blood pool, dripping with blood. They edge on, towards the tunnel.  83. Picking their way through discarded bones. One false foot will alert them all. Rios suddenly steps inches from Greg’s half-eaten head. Rios’s urge to gag intense. PARASITES crawl out, onto her boot. She steels herself, follows the others into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several feet in, they reach a JUNCTION at the base of a sinkhole. Far, far above: a distant pinprick of LIGHT. A chimney-like structure, formed by falling water, its sh sides are round and smooth. Feeling the smooth wall, Sara talks at a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We can’t hammer in holds, we’ll upset the neighbours.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Two people, back to back. A beat. Someone must be left below. Sarah and Rios look a each other, at Juno, not quite trusting her.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I couldn’t climb a tree.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We’1l drop a rope.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You better. Sarah and Rios, back to back, legs pressed on opposing wa crab their way up the chimney. Every friction hold dislodges small stones and rock dust trickle down. Agonising moments for Juno, at the bottom, aware of the eaters that might be alerted down the tunnel. She sees ho shapes shuffle in her thermal imaging. Rios’s untrained leg wobbles, strains for a hold. They struggle to keep their shape. Knocking a carabiner from Sarah’s belt... It falls forever...  84. Lands with a CLANG. Juno sees crawlers stir, raises her pick. Then the crawlers thankfully return to their troughing. Finally Sarah and Rios reach a ledge, halfway up. From he the chimney tapers such that one person can continue alon

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Keep climbing. Rios hesitates, then presses on for the top. At the bottom, Juno winces at every SCUFF of her boots, e falls of dislodged rock. Sarah throws a rope down, tugs it tight for Juno. Juno starts her rope climb, struggling with her injured l alert to every noise. The metallic CLICK of every clasp. CREAK of rope. The JANGLE of metal buckles against rock.. Juno hears crawler’s rustling. Nervous. Sarah holds the rope, taking Juno’s weight, her muscles burning, her hands burning against taut rope. Juno’s injured leg buckles as she struggles to yank herse up faster. She loses her grip, slips back to the bottom. Juno struggles to steady herself, flailing for handholds the smooth rockface. SLAM. Juno lands hard at the bottom- lets out a CRY. She grits her teeth against the pain. Too late. Crawlers stop eating! An eerie silence. Sarah can see two crawlers closing in on Juno below her Juno swings her pick, fending them off. Above her she can see Rios climbing towards the light. She could leave now and follow Rios.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Go. Go after her. Sarah hesitates. Rios looks back, alive to her dilemma. Two huge lead CRAWLERS pincer in on Juno.  85. There’s no escape... Sarah drops down on a rope. She lands her boots on the first crawlers head, slamming pick into the second huge crawler... Sarah faces Juno. No time to talk. A mother of a battle t fight. Whilst Rios climbs, Sarah and Juno hack at whatever comes them. Chopping. Cutting. Smashing...Side by side, Sarah a Juno slice, scythe, sever... A bloody blur of close-quarter combat, Sarah and Juno bar distinguishable from the Crawlers they fight. A Crawler lunges. Sinks its teeth into Sarah’s arm. Juno buries her pick into the Crawler’s back. The Crawler releases it jaws to SCREECH in agony, revealing its neck. Juno rams the axe right into the Crawler’s jugular Juno takes an excruciating claw-wound to her injured leg. Sarah jumps in, taking a heavy gut blow- crawler’s claws- that was meant for Juno. Back to back, Sarah and Juno dispatch the crawlers with a barrage of blows. ...Finally there are none left. Everything is dead. Juno and Sarah stand together at the centre of a bloody circle. Turning, they come face to face with one another. A bapti in blood. From all the tunnels, CLICKS, SCUTTLING... Juno picks up the thermal imaging camera. Every way she turns, down every tunnel, red spots: crawlers, closing in...HORDES OF THEM.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: My leg’s fucked. Go. I’11 hold them.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t last a minute.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I lasted two days.  86.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I know. The crawlers close fast. Sarah coughs up blood, presses the deadly gash on her tor Juno understands the full extent of her injuries. A device on Sarah’s belt FLASHES red: Dan’s gas detector.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Methane. That stuff’1ll kill you. Reading each other’s thoughts, they somehow find smiles. Hearing the crawlers coming through the tunnels, Sarah an Juno turn to face them. Both wield picks. Tired. Fighters in the final round. Juno can barely walk. Sarah’s little better: her breathin laboured; dripping blood. Together they stumble away from sinkhole, towards the enemy, into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: COMEONNNNNN
dialogues.text: The Crawlers turn en masse. Snarl and screech. Sarah and Juno slip into a side tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios climbs. Emotion shudders through her. But as Rios climbs higher and higher, she grits her teeth ...fixes her eyes on the light at the end of the TUNNEL. Onward, upward, toward the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crawlers HUNT. VOICES draw them deeper into the dark... They hunt it down. Turn a corner, find... THE CAMCORDER... playing..the party scene.. all the girls the first film...laughing and having fun...friends... A false trail.  87. A crawler sniffs the camcorder, swipes it aside. The crawlers listen out for other noises. Hearing Rios GRUNTS and SCUFFLES as she climbs... With lethal speed, they set out after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios makes for the light above. Below, she hears the crawlers. Then she sees them.

dialogues.speaker: THIS WAY YOU BLIND FUCKS
dialogues.text: The crawlers turn away, after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead-end. Sarah and Juno huddle. Two broken warriors.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: Your belts still flashing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s a fashion thing. It’s Dan’s gas detector: on red alert for methane.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: You got gas?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Something terrible. You got a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios climbs towards the light, knowing the others are bel

dialogues.speaker: INT. DEAD END
dialogues.text: Juno pulls a zippo lighter.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s Holly’s? (Juno nods) This is yours.  88. Sarah hands Juno the ‘love each day’ pendant Paul gave he They interlock the pendant in their hands. They share a look. A silent communion.

dialogues.speaker: JUNO
dialogues.text: I’1l see you in hell.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not if I see you first. The Crawlers inch closer. Surround Sarah and Juno. Sarah flicks the lighter. The naked flame ignites the METHANE. A FIREBALL rolls through the cave, swallowing and smiting everything. Killing all CRAWLERS... Consuming the CAMCORDER: all the girls, in the cabin, laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Crawler SCREECHES and smoke rising behind her, Rios climbs up toward the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rios spills out into the surface. Dawn is just breaking. Spectral light. She’s halfway up the mountain. Deep in forest. She rolls over. Overwhelmed. Gulping air. Practically cry Then she sees a stag. Running for its life, from unseen predators. Blurred shapes, chasing it through the trees. A familiar CLICK...CLICK... Rios’s face suddenly tightens.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: They hunt above ground. Rios looks around. The nightmare’s not over Rios hunkers down, pulls out her mobile phone. Dials 911.  89.

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: This is Deputy Elen Rios. I need backup. Hearing a noise, she turns back to the sinkhole. Peers back into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: RIOS
dialogues.text: Sarah? Juno? Straining to see into the pitch black. Flashframe: CRAWLER JAWS, CLOSING IN... BLACK.
